Definition_e: Vertical column integral of spectral aerosol absorption coefficient: AAOD = exp(-K. &Delta z) where K is the absorption coefficient [km<sup>-1</sup>] and &Delta z the vertical path [km]
2D field of the column burden of condensed particles in the atmosphere
3-D field of concentration of dust or sand in the atmosphere

3D field of mean aerosol particle size, defined as the ratio of the third and second moments of the number size distribution of aerosol particles. Requested in the troposphere (assumed height: 12 km) and as columnar average.
3D field of spectral volumetric extinction cross-section of aerosol particles.

Definition_e: 3D field of mass mixing ratio of volcanic ash

Definition_e: Field of total column mass of volcanic ash

Name_e: Air temperature (at specified distance from reference surface)

Path_e: \Outer Space\Energetic particles / solar wind \Particle flux\Alpha particles differential directional flux
\Outer Space\Energetic particles / solar wind \Particle flux\Alpha particles integral directional flux
Definition_e: An alpha particle has positive charge and consists of two protons and two neutrons (the nucleus of a helium atom). Flux is the rate of flow through a reference surface, measured in particles per unit area.The directional flux is the flux limited to a certain solid angle as a function of the direction (pitch angle).
3D field of density of the atmosphere
Occurence of fluorescence of the upper atmosphere through ionization by energetic charged particles accelerated by the Earth's magnetic field.
Total amount of vegetation in a reference area - Physical unit: [ t/ha (tons/hectare) ] - Accuracy unit: [ t/ha ]

Name_e: C6H6Cl6 (1,2,3,4,5,6-hexachlorocyclohexane, alpha-lindane, alpha-HCH), in wet precipitation
C6H6Cl6 (1,2,3,4,5,6-hexachlorocyclohexane, gamma-lindane, gamma-HCH), in wet precipitation

Path_e: \Atmosphere\Aerosol\Physical properties - secondary\CCN concentration at single supersaturation

Definition_e: 1D variable colloquially referred to as &ldquo wave spectrum&rdquo. Describes the wave energy in each frequency band (e.g. 25 frequency bands) regardless of the direction of propagation
Indicator of living phytoplankton biomass, extracted from ocean colour observation. Uncertainty is expressed in mg/m<sup>3</sup> for a given concentration of 1 mg/m<sup>3</sup> .
Size distribution of liquid water drops, assimilated to spheres of the same volume. Considered as both a 3D field throughout the troposphere and a 2D field at the top of cloud surface.
3D field of atmospheric water in the solid phase (precipitating or not).
Size distribution of ice particles, assimilated to spheres of the same volume. Considered as both a 3D field throughout the troposphere and a 2D field at the top of cloud surface
Field of atmospheric water in the solid phase (precipitating or not) as total column.
3D field of atmospheric water in the liquid phase (precipitating or not).
Field of atmospheric water in the liquid phase (precipitating or not).

Effective depth of a cloud from the viewpoint of radiation propagation. OD = exp(-K.&Deltaz) where K is the extinction coefficient [km<sup>-1</sup> ] and &Delta z the vertical path [km] between the base and the top of the cloud
Flux of carbon dioxide from the surface to the atmosphere
Deviation of sea level from local references in coastal zones, caused by local currents and tides (astronomical and wind-induced).
Conductivity measured by CTD or MicroCAT

Path_e: \Outer Space\Energetic particles / solar wind \Particle flux\Cosmic ray neutron flux spectrum
Definition_e: Flux density energy spectrum of neutrons from the Sun or as component of the cosmic radiation.

Name_e: COS (OCS, carbon oxide sulfide, carbonyl sulfide)

Definition_e: Changes in time of the position and height of the Earth plates. Indicative of the lithosphere dynamics, thus useful for earthquake prediction - Physical unit: [ mm/y ] - Accuracy unit: [ mm/y ].
Basis for monitoring the evolution of the lithosphere dynamics - Physical unit: [ cm ] - Accuracy unit: [ cm ].

Path_e: \Terrestrial\Land surface\Snow / Ice / Glacier\Snow\Depth of fresh snowfall
\Atmosphere\Temperature\Dew-point temperature (at specified distance from reference surface)
Name_e: Dew-point temperature (at specified distance from reference surface)

Definition_e: Indicator of water turbidity and vertical processes in the ocean, extracted from ocean colour observation.
The cumulated concentration of inorganic carbon species (dissolved carbon dioxide, carbonic acid, bicarbonate and carbonate) in solution.
One feature of the ocean wave spectrum. It is the direction of the most energetic wave in the spectrum - Physical unit: [ degrees ] - Accuracy unit: [ degrees ].
The period of the most energetic wave in the ocean wave spectrum.
Rotation velocity of the Earth, determining the length of the day - Physical unit: [Rad/s] - Accuracy unit: [Arcsec/century].
Magnitude and direction of the Earth's electriv field
3-D field of the electron density in the ionosphere

Definition_e: Flux density energy spectrum of low-, medium-, and high-energy electrons from the magnetosphere, the radiation belts or the interplanetary medium, per unit solid angle

Path_e: \Outer Space\Energetic particles / solar wind \Particle flux\Electron flux density
Definition_e: Flux density of low-, medium-, and high-energy electrons from the magnetosphere, the radiation belts or the interplanetary medium.

Path_e: \Outer Space\Energetic particles / solar wind \Electron flux energy spectrum
Definition_e: Flux density energy spectrum of low-, medium-, and high-energy electrons from the magnetosphere, the radiation belts or the interplanetary medium.

Definition_e: Flux density of low-, medium-, and high-energy electrons from the magnetosphere, the radiation belts or the interplanetary medium, per unit solid angle.
Measurement of the electrostatic charge of a satellite accumulated because of the environmental situation.
Radiative flux integrated over the EUV band.
Energy spectrum of the radiative flux measured in the EUV band.
Quantity of water evaporated from the soil and plants when the ground is at its natural moisture content.

Path_e: \Atmosphere\Temperature\Extreme temperature (min, max) (at specified distance from reference surface)
Name_e: Extreme temperature (min, max) (at specified distance from reference surface)

Definition_e: Fraction of a land area where fire is occurring
Power radiated by the fire occurring within an area
Temperature of the fire occurring within an area
Flurometric  colored dissolved Organic matter concentration
The highest ordinary-wave frequency reflected back from a sporadic E layer and observed by an ionosonde.
Critical frequency of the F2 layer of the ionosphere. This critical frequency (f, in MHz) is associated with the electron density (Ne, in cm<sup>-3</sup>): f=9*10<sup>-3</sup>*sqrt(Ne).
Fraction of PAR absorbed by vegetation (land or marine) for photosynthesis processes (generally around the 'red' )
Fraction of a land area where vegetation is present
Height of the atmospheric layer in cloud where liquid-solid states transform into each other
Radiative flux integrated over the gamma-ray domain.
Energy spectrum of the radiative flux measured in the gamma-ray domain.

Equipotential surface which would coincide exactly with the mean ocean surface of the Earth, if the oceans were in equilibrium, at rest, and extended through the continents (such as with very narrow channels) - Physical unit: [ cm ] - Accuracy unit: [ cm ].
Magnitude and direction of the 3D magnetic field on the surface of Earth and within the magnetosphere (i.e., in low-Earth orbit and in geosynchronous orbit).
Fraction of a land area covered by permanent ice
Velocity of the ice measured at the surface of a glacier
Map of the height of the glacier surface.
Indicative of the statics and dynamics of the lithosphere and the mantle - Physical unit: [ mGal ] where : 1 Gal = 0.01 m.s<sup>-2</sup>
Gradient of the Earth¿ gravity field measured at the satellite orbital height - Physical unit: [ E ] , E?tv?s (1 E = 1 mGal / 10 km) - Accuracy unit: [ E ].
Amount of water present beneath the ground surface per unit area
3D field of mole fraction of H<sub>2</sub>O = Water vapour (intended as a chemical species relevant for atmospheric chemistry).
3D field of mole fraction of HDO = Water vapour (with one hydrogen nucleus replaced by its deuterium isotope)

Path_e: \Outer Space\Energetic particles / solar wind \Interplanetary magnetic field
Definition_e: Vector magnetic field (3D) in the solar wind.The reference frame is Cartesian or Cylindrical with many different axis orientations. Important in Space Weather to monitor magnetic disturbances of the near earth environment.
Total number of ionized particles in a volume unit of ionospheric plasma
Velocity of bulk plasma or electrons (depending on measurement technique) as a function of altitude in the ionosphere.
Attenuation of a radio wave passing through the lower ionosphere.
Random fluctuations of radio waves resulting of small scale variations of the ionospheric electron density in space and time.

Definition_e: Number of electrons between two points.
Aera extent of the surface of a lake
Map of the height of the lake surface.
Temperature of the lake surface - Physical unit: [ K ] - Accuracy unit: [ K ].

Processed from land surface imagery by assigning identified cluster(s) within a given area to specific classes of objects - Accuracy expressed as number of classes. Actually [ classes-1 ] is used, so that smaller figure corresponds to better performance, as usual.
Temperature of the apparent surface of land (bare soil or vegetation) - Physical unit: [ K ] - Accuracy unit: [ K ].
Map of land surface heights - Physical unit: [ m ] - Accuracy unit: [ m ].
LAI is the total one-sided area of photosynthetic tissue per unit ground surface area

Detection of the time and location (latitude, longitude) of lightning events. Accuracy expressed in terms of Hit Rate and False Alarm Rate, which requires predetermination of a specific distance and time tolerance .

Difference between maximum (in NIR) and minimum (around the Red) vegetation reflectance, normalised to the summation. Representative of total biomass, supportive for computing LAI if not directly measured

Name_e: Occurrence of precipitation during last period

Definition_e: Ocean motion measured at various depth levels.
Deviation of sea level from the geoid caused by ocean currents (after corrections for tides and atmospheric pressure effects) - Physical unit: [ cm ] - Accuracy unit: [ cm ].
3D field of salinity of the ocean Requested in upper and deep ocean - Physical unit: [ psu ], Practical Salinity Unit, close to 1, determined by CTD
Water flow on ocean surface - Physical unit: [ cm/s ] - Accuracy unit: [ cm/s ] intended as vector error, i.e. the module of the vector difference between the observed vector and the true vector.

Variable extracted from ocean colour observation. Indicative of river outflow, re-suspension or pollution of other-than-biological origin. Uncertainty expressed in g/m<sup>3</sup> at a specific concentration (e.g., 2 g/m<sup>3</sup> ).
3D field of temperature of the ocean Requested in upper and deep ocean.
Fraction of an ocean area polluted by hydrocarbons released from ships or off-shore platforms, accidentally or deliberately.
Flux of CO2 from the ocean into the atmosphere
The hydrogen ion concentration in seawater, which is a measure of acidity and alkalinity
Flux of downwelling photons of wavelength 0.4-0.7

Definition_e: 3D field of the dose rate of energetic particles
Travelling radio-waves of solar, galactic and extragalactic origin, entering the Earth's environment.
Volume of water flowing through a river per unit of time
Fraction of an ocean area where ice is present
Elevation of the surface of the sea-ice sheet above sea level
Sea-ice surface characteristics (albedo, meltpond, dust, snow properties, temperature)
Temperature of the surface of sea-ice.
Thickness of the ice sheet. It is related to sea-ice elevation and ice density

Variable convolving several factors (age, roughness, density, etc.) - Accuracy expressed as number of classes. Actually [ classes^-1 ] is used, so that smaller figure corresponds to better performance as usual.
Salinity of sea water in the surface layer (upper ~ 1 m if observed in MW). In the open ocean the correct term should be ¿halinity¿ with reference of the diversity of salts involved.
Temperature of the sea water at surface. The ¿bulk¿ temperature refers to the depth of typically 2 m, the ¿skin¿ temperature refers to within the upper 1 mm.
Reflectance of the solar radiation from clouds
Average amplitude of the highest 30 of 100 waves.

Path_e: \Terrestrial\Land surface\Snow / Ice / Glacier\Snow\Snow cover (fraction of area)
Definition_e: Fraction of a given area which is covered by snow
Vertical distance from the snow surface to the underlying surface (ground, glacier ice or sea ice).
Binary product (dry or melting/thawing) expressing the presence of liquid water in a snow layer- Accuracy expressed as Hit Rate [ HR ] and False Alarm Rate [ FAR ].
Vertical depth of the water that would be obtained by melting a snow layer. Linked to snow depth through the density of the snow layer.
Fractional content of water in a volume of wet soil. Surface layer (upper few centimetres)
Sub-soil 3D field of the fractional content of water in a volume of wet soil. Requested from surface down to ~ 3 m

The standard depths for soil temperature measurements are 5, 10, 20, 50 and 100 cm below the surface; additional depths may be included. The site for such measurements should be a level plot of bare ground (about 75 cm^2 ) and typical of the surrounding soil for which information is required.
Result of the classification of different types of soil within an area - Accuracy expressed as inverse of the number of classes, so that smaller figures correspond to better performance.
Image of the Sun in the K-line of Ca-II(393.4 nm)
Image of the solar corona surrounding the Sun.
Map of magnitude and direction of the electric field at the solar surface (photosphere).
Integrated EUV flux over the solar disk
Energy spectrum of the EUV flux integrated over the solar disk.
Images of the Sun in the Extreme Ultra-Violet (EUV) wavelengths in order to identify features such as filaments, active regions and coronal holes.
Integrated gamma-ray flux over the solar disk
Energy spectrum of the gamma-ray flux integrated over the solar disk
Image of the Sun in the Hydrogen-alpha transition wavelength (656.3 nm).
Solar flux in the Hydrogen Lyman-alpha transition wavelength (121.6 nm)
Image of the Sun in the Hydrogen Lyman-alpha transition wavelength (121.6 nm)
Vector magnetic field (1D or 3D) at the solar surface (photosphere/chromosphere)
Integrated radio flux over the solar disk.
Solar radio flux energy spectrum integrated over the solar disk.
2D image of the solar radio flux
Integrated UV flux over the solar disk.
Energy spectrum of the UV flux integrated over the solar disk.
Images of the Sun in the UV wavelengths.
Map of 3D velocity of particles of the Solar atmosphere, significant of the Sun interior.
Integrated VIS flux over the solar disk
Energy spectrum of the integrated VIS flux over the solar disk.
Images of the Sun in the VIS wavelengths.
Image of the Sun in white light

Definition_e: The amount of acid necessary to titrate all weak bases in seawater.
3D field of kinetic energy density of turbulent motion of the air

Name_e: Turbulence type (low levels and wake vortex)

Definition_e: Result of cloud type classification - Accuracy expressed as inverse of number of classes, so that smaller figures correspond to better performance.

Result of the classification of different types of vegetation within a vegetated area - Accuracy expressed as inverse of the number of classes, so that smaller figures correspond to better performance.
Upward spectral radiance from the ocean surface, i.e. amount of light leaving the ocean per unit area, per wavelength and per solid angle.
1D variable colloquially referred to as &ldquo wave spectrum&rdquo. Describes the wave energy in each frequency band (e.g. 25 frequency bands) regardless of the direction of propagation

2D variable colloquially referred to as wave spectrum. Describes the wave energy travelling in each direction and frequency band (e.g., 24 distinct azimuth sectors each 15° wide, and 25 frequency bands)
average of height (trough to crest) of the waves collected through a specified time

The time required for two successive wave crests to pass a fixed point, or the time for a single wave crest to travel a distance equal to the length of the wave. This is averaged over a specified period of time.
Fraction of an area flood by water
The shear force per unit area exerted by wind blowing over the sea surface -

the aggregate of animal or animal-like organisms in plankton, as protozoans
